Species.Name: Clawdite
Species.Description:
[H4]Clawdite[h4] Clawdites are a humanoid sentient species native to the planet of Zolan. They are one of the few shape-shifting species in the galaxy, and are sometimes referred to as Changelings. [P][B]Physiology:[b] In their natural form, Clawdites have the appearance of reptilian humanoids, and in fact have evolved from reptomammals. They have sunken cheeks with a narrow nose and a small mouth. A thin line runs down their foreheads and creases the center of their noses. They possess large eyes with slit-like pupils, and their irises can be yellow, gold, or blue. Their skin is considered to be rough, and ranges in color from green to yellow. Overall, their appearance is identical to that of their genetic forebears, the Zolanders. [P]Due to genetic manipulation, Clawdites possess the extremely rare ability to change their appearance. When using this ability, they can change the color and texture of their skin and eyes, mimicking the appearance of other similarly-shaped beings, such as Humans. Shifting into a Weequay, a species with similar facial features, is considered to be an easy task. Though they can not add physical mass to their bodies, they are able to form hair, and can actually make it quite long. Clawdites are also able to mimic the appearance of clothing or jewelry, provided that the item lays directly on their skin, as it is merely a manipulation of their skin's texture. They can not change the appearance of their actual clothing, and have to rely on holographic technology in order to change such items. [P]The growth of their abilities mainly relies upon a Clawdite's age. Younglings are only able to change color, a talent that begins at infancy, and baby Clawdites use different hues and colors to indicate their needs to their parents.
[P]Unlike most shape-changing species, the Clawdite's shifting abilities actually cause them great physical discomfort. While the range of their abilities vary in individuals, with both age and practice, they can work through the pain of changing in order to alter their appearance in more and more extreme ways. Even the most talented Clawdite, however, lacks the fine coordination it would take to mimic a specific individual's appearance precisely. Only a very talented Clawdite is able to sleep and retain their altered form. If a Clawdite is suitably distracted or hurt, and certainly if they are killed, they will revert to their true form.
[P]It is thought to be impossible for a Clawdite to actually change their body structure or body mass, though it appears that some individual Clawdites managed this feat through unknown means. As most sentient beings' bodies are composed mostly of water, xenobiologists speculated that the Clawdites ability to change may lie in the manipulation of water.
[P][B]Society:[b] By nature, Clawdites are quiet and solitary beings, often shunning the company of others unless it benefited them. They view the rest of the galaxy pragmatically, and are often harsh realists who are mistrustful and suspicious of others. [P]Not all Clawdites use their shape-shifting abilities, but those who do are forced to undertake great physical pain and effort in order to do so. They often learn meditation and concentration techniques, over long periods of time, in order to maximize their capabilities. It is also necessary for Clawdites to treat their skin with specialized oils in order to prevent cracking or tearing, due to the difficulty in physically maintaining their disguises. [P]While in their natural form, they are considered to be indistinguishable from their Zolander brethren, but it is possible to distinguish the two via genetic examination.
[P]On their homeworld of Zolan, Clawdites are feared and shunned by the Zolanders, who are a deeply religious people. Among their many strong convictions, the Zolanders believe the Clawdites to be impure and sinful. Because of their prejudice, the Zolanders forced the Clawdites to live in slums all across the planet. These ghettos are secured, so that the Zolanders could prevent the Clawdites from spreading. This subjugation continued for centuries on end, and it wasn't until after 4 ABY that they were able to change their situation. After the rise of their new government, the Clawdites began to hold classes for schoolchildren, in order to teach them greater control and efficiency with their abilities.
[P]The few Clawdites who leave their world most often took advantage of their natural abilities to join militaristic professions, such as spying, assassination, and bounty hunting. Joining groups such as these are the rare occasions where Clawdites afford their loyalty to others, and they see it as a positive contribution to the galaxy. They often seek to protect the liberties of other species, sensing in their pain the disparity their own people suffered. [P][B]Homeworld:[b] Zolan was the homeworld of the Zolander species and its Clawdite offshoot. The Zolanders were loyal to the Galactic Republic, but the Clawdites were loyal to the Confederacy of Independent Systems, with the false hope the Confederacy would liberate them from Zolander oppression. [P][B]Language:[b] Clawdite is the language of Clawdites, from planet Zolan. It is a modified version of Zolanese. Spoken Clawdite is basically formed by hissing sibilants. Guttural croaks are used in some parts of the sentence.

Option.Name: Change Form
Option.Description: At the cost of 2 Strain, a Clawdite can choose to upgrade their Deception check to convey a false appearance which lasts until the Clawdite wills the change to end, or until they are knocked unconscious or killed. The Strain spent is not recovered until the Clawdite reverts back to their normal shape.
